documents.document: @Ctracy861 description sounds a bit 'meh business book' but it's really interesting thus far.
@Ctracy861 I spotted that you were reading it and added it to my list. :D I'm currently reading this : https://t.co/o4SduHkMoc
“One Surprising Truth about Introverts” by @larrykim https://t.co/eq72HikkIM
@postenterprise indeed. And I'm sure those who lose out in the shuffle will likely be those who are already on their knees.
@postenterprise having listened to that podcast, I have deep reservations that whatever we give up to 'take back control' it'll be too much.
Listening to... Desolation Radio: Wales Bill feat. Richard Wyn Jones https://t.co/7DyS3JUv3d

@BakedIdea Agreed! Very encouraging.
Good post on the importance of challenging your own hidden assumptions. https://t.co/2tpg2ioKgf
@dorkomatic me too! 👍
Signed! Almost at the 3 million mark for signatories. https://t.co/O9KRaDkP2l
Petition: Prevent Donald Trump from making a State Visit to the United Kingdom. https://t.co/lcAg97ZcP4

I forgot that the Apple logo used to be upside down. https://t.co/aa1BCZcTdm
Too true! https://t.co/a1s5ySxgKb
@shirleyayres absolutely! People get hung up on technology, when they should be focusing on how it furthers their core purpose.
@PaulBromford cheers Paul! I'm notching 'less than shitty' up as a reasonable start. 😄
@antonyslumbers and thus created a dependency where he might get called back. Urrrgh!
Worth keeping an eye on #nhshd today. https://t.co/t30y6Eyt1J
Probably lining him up for some god awful Enterprise software that runs on Windows and looks like it was designed i… https://t.co/GieJGzYfdn
Happy Friday! Braindump #16 inbound! 😎 https://t.co/F5sBeW1pGu
Attention #ukhousing types! Who's thinking about User Experience? Interested in this? https://t.co/I8qwnibYHi
Occasionally I spot a Yammer post and get a glimpse of the future of work we've been promised. #workingoutloud https://t.co/bpdWF5Bxvu
@ngoodrich87 this 'will of the people' stuff makes gnash my teeth because it ignores the basic concept of representative democracy.
@ngoodrich87 I think people are so disengaged from the process that they don't understand the fundamentals.
@ngoodrich87 didn't we know that before? A portion of America find those admirable traits. 🙄
When we're eventually managed by algorithms, will self motivation become a problem? https://t.co/06oGC4mSlH
@HelReynolds bookmarked as an example of 'authentic voice'. 👌
@whatsthepont on similar lines to deviant librarians.. seen this? https://t.co/2O5jV6n0P5
If you're interseted in making local democracy better, you may be interested in this.. #NotWestminster https://t.co/5V3O3ZZtI1 @EventbriteUK
@likeaword a Google search on 'Council Portal' tells me otherwise!
This may be the only context in which 'portals' are acceptable. https://t.co/189h3KMm8d
Alright. Should we make a pact to stop using the word 'portal' in relation to websites?
@DyfrigWilliams Hi mate - hope you're feeling better today. Are these guys on your radar? https://t.co/o11zH43sEU
@ballantine70 Ha! If all cars were automated, no problem. Bloody humans causing problems again! ;)
@ballantine70 I have a vague recollection of someone developing a car with a 'face' on the front to communicate to others what it was doing.
@paulturner500 @ngoodrich87 amen! 🙌 The alternative are big rambling expensive IT projects that 'fix' the wrong problems.
@ngoodrich87 @paulturner500 progress is being made, but I'm sure there's still some IT depts that rule technology with an iron grip!
@RobJefferson @paulturner500 yep. Also helps build empathy for service users. And build digital literacy if they're directly involved.
@RobJefferson @paulturner500 + as Paul says, big part is cultural change. So can't have departments absolving responsibility to IT/Digital.
.@RobJefferson @paulturner500 think it comes back to having digital skills embedded across org. Old model was to concentrate it in one place
This all sounds distinctly familiar. Great to see some working out loud via @paulturner500 https://t.co/p07RAyP3h9 https://t.co/RTJ3J6X123
@DyfrigWilliams Penblwydd Hapus! 🍻Day in watching Serpico sounds pretty ace. Shame about the lurgi. 👎
Catching up with last weeks @TheSatoriLab email newsletter. Some good brain food in here. https://t.co/eYGmY7kjLA
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford Paternalism is the default setting. I wonder how many are even aware?
And while there's no legislation around the maximum passengers you can cram on a train, it's in Arriva's interest to maximise profit.
The challenge is fundamentally about capacity of services (or lack thereof) during peak times. Seems very little intention to tackle that.
"The challenge for us is how do we make the best possible service we can with the trains that we've got." - wrong c… https://t.co/s6CeQvXXu0
“Cognitive bias cheat sheet, simplified” by @buster https://t.co/p4bbsyY7Ox
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford how often do users have a choice in the IT they use in the workplace? :D (hardly ever)
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford have seen this loads within the microcosm of IT system implementations. Same sort of principles at play imho.
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford I think paternalism plays a part. Where people don't behave as expected, the temptation is to force/nudge them.
Most things that are wrong with traditional IT encapsulated in one tweet. https://t.co/uM8u8zEVxy
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford or more accurately, putting organisational needs in front of user needs is an option.
@shirleyayres @PaulBromford If your customer isn't really a customer (because they have to use your services) then ignorance is an option.
@allyblue22 I've learned from some of the best! ;)
@PaulBromford Nice one Paul! Hope the return from paradise hasn't been too jarring. ;)
Heard of a few instances where web chat has died a swift death. In those instances, I wonder if it's been pondered from perspective of user.
I've recently had cause to revisit this GDS post on webchat interfaces. Some really useful insights within. https://t.co/3u18UsXNds
Impressive prediction from 1995. https://t.co/EOzj2gWltX
@markjhooper probably the work of the brussel sprout lobby!
New post : A reminder that building systems without seeing them in action leads to terrible customer experience. https://t.co/888Xhkd09o
Whenever I see stuff like this.. Who's funded that research? Has this been peer reviewed? https://t.co/TOOn8J2Mfe

We get taxed for purely existing. So why not pay people for existing too? https://t.co/afsRy8rnNI
@britz thanks Mark! You've summarised my post beautifully there. 👍
@davidcarboni Cheers David! Wish I'd hit this realisation a few years earlier and saved myself some stress.

@GlynRJones is it down the bottom? I've noticed they've been A/B testing the location of it.
Half day spent talking about digital services with tenants, other half spent ruminating on leadership with colleagues. Excellent brain food.

@ballantine70 have you just described the gig economy! ;)

@ballantine70 of course! 👍
@ballantine70 really good observations Matt. Side projects have always been my mechanism for 'play' when I couldn't get away with it in work
@theobisean maybe it’s a new thing? Really cool idea.

I'm on the scout for digital maturity models. This one looks interesting - https://t.co/uhGuJiJKjD - does anyone else have a better 'un?

Encouraging! We need lots of trials. More data & evidence the better. HT @BasicIncWales https://t.co/2sZZHkUxzn
Amen! Critical feedback is a goldmine for learning & improvement. https://t.co/yQU7k9VAJj
Just finished reading Turn The Ship Around by David Marquet. Highlights the pitfalls of command & control + how to address them.

@dosticen Aw, thanks Lorna! As ever, I'm delighted if anyone else finds something useful in there. :)
Not happy about these Internet Explorer pop ups suddenly appearing in #Windows10. https://t.co/tg94tkYvUp
@DaveAFloyd could you argue that this is aimed at staff that wouldn't have utilised Exchange/Outlook/Office?
@RobJefferson Ownership.. as in they want to retain ownership of it?
This new staff hub thing from Microsoft looks interesting. Productivity tools for front line workers. https://t.co/FVwf9MaNsO
@RobJefferson Yes, good point! Easy to get disconnected from the experience of using a mobile device. Do you test stuff with users?
